newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil coffee may see colder weather soon - Somar.
newsitem.headline: Brazil coffee may see colder weather soon - Somar.

text.p: A significant polar air mass may pass through Brazil's coffee regions from the evening of July 5 which could represent the greatest frost risk seen so far this year, local meteorologists Somar said.

The polar air mass, currently expected to have an intensity of 1,032 millibars on July 4, could lead to temperatures of around zero degrees Celsius in north Parana and southwest Sao Paulo states on the nights of July 5 and July 6, Somar said.

Cloud cover should protect the north of Sao Paulo and south/Cerrado regions of Minas Gerais over the weekend but given the air mass may stay until July 9, the nights of July 7 and 8 will be the most critical for those regions, Somar said.
"If this air mass comes in, it will certainly be the most intense we have seen so far this winter," said Somar forecaster Marcos Massari.
In the short-term, the southern coffee regions should see rain throughout the week, with seasonal temperatures expected throughout the coffee belt.
